org.apache.flex.compiler.common

Class NodeReference

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.flex.compiler.common.NodeReference

  • public class NodeReference
extends Object
    Helper class to abstract the details of how we get back to Nodes from Definitions and NamespaceReferences. This class holds a WeakRef to the IASNode, and is able to regenerate the IASNode if needed after it has been collected.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static NodeReference noReference
      static that represents no NodeReference (e.g. for defs that came from an ABC)

    • Constructor Detail

      • NodeReference

        public NodeReference(IASNode node)
        Construct a NodeReference to the given node
        Parameters:
        node - the node to references

      • NodeReference

        public NodeReference(IFileSpecification containingFileSpec,
             int absoluteStart)
        Construct a NodeReference to a node in the specified file at the specified offset. This constructor is used from the MXMLScopeBuilder, where we only have temporary tree nodes.
        Parameters:
        containingFileSpec - File that contains the node this reference refers to.
        absoluteStart - The offset at which the node this reference refers to starts.

    • Method Detail

      • getFileSpecification

        public IFileSpecification getFileSpecification()
        Get the file spec for this Node

      • getAbsoluteStart

        public int getAbsoluteStart()
        Get the start offset for the node

      • getNode

        public IASNode getNode(IWorkspace workspace,
              ASScope scope)
        Get a strong reference to the Node. If necessary this will reparse the file to find the correct Node. This method may return null, such as when document is so malformed that we can't produce a file node for it. (Note that MXMLScopeBuilder can produce definitions with NodeReferences into a malformed document.)
        Parameters:
        workspace - the Workspace to use to parse the file
        scope - the containing scope of the definition we want the node for - this is used to find the ASFileScope it's contained in to reconnect the definitions and Nodes if the file needs to be reparsed

      • getNodeIfExists

        public IASNode getNodeIfExists()
        Get the node from the underlying weak reference. This will not do any parsing or any other work to recover the Node if it has been collected
        Returns:
        the IASNode this reference refers to, or null if the Node no longer exists

      • reconnectNode

        public void reconnectNode(IASNode node)
        Explicitly re-connect this node reference to the specified node.
        Parameters:
        node - The IASNode to re-connect this node reference to.
